questions.name: If tan⁡θ+tan⁡4 θ+tan⁡7 θ=tan⁡θtan⁡4 θtan⁡7 θ, then θ=
questions.nameText: If tan⁡θ+tan⁡4 θ+tan⁡7 θ=tan⁡θtan⁡4 θtan⁡7 θ, then θ=
questions.solution:
We have,

tan⁡θ+tan⁡4 θ+tan⁡7 θ=tan⁡θtan⁡4 θtan⁡7 θ

⇒tan⁡θ+tan⁡4 θ=-tan⁡7 θ(1-tan⁡θtan⁡4 θ)

⇒tan⁡θ+tan⁡4 θ1-tan⁡θtan⁡4 θ=tan⁡(-7 θ)

⇒tan⁡5 θ=tan⁡(-7 θ)

⇒5 θ=n π+-7 θ,n∈Z⇒θ=n π12,n∈Z

=sin⁡(3A+A)sin⁡3A-Asin2⁡Acos2⁡A

=4sin⁡Acos⁡Acos⁡2A2sin⁡Acos⁡Asin2⁡Acos2⁡A=8cos⁡2A

questions.nameText: If in a ∆ABC,3sin⁡A=6sin⁡B=23sin⁡C, , then angle A is

questions.nameText: If x=ycos⁡2π3=zcos⁡4π3 , then xy+yz+zx=

questions.nameText: If α+β-γ=π , then sin2⁡α+sin2⁡β-sin2⁡γ  is equal to

questions.name: If 0<A<π6 and sin⁡A+cos⁡A=72 , then tan⁡A2=
questions.nameText: If 0<A<π6  and sin⁡A+cos⁡A=72 , then tan⁡A2=
questions.solution:

⇒4tan⁡A2+2-2tan2⁡A2=7+7tan2⁡A2

questions.name: If A+B+C=0 , then the value of ∑cot⁡B+C-Acot⁡C+A-B is equal to
questions.nameText: If A+B+C=0 , then the value of ∑cot⁡B+C-Acot⁡C+A-B  is equal to
questions.solution:
We have,

∑cot⁡B+C-Acot⁡C+A-B

=∑cot⁡2Acot⁡2B∵A+B+C=0

=cot⁡2Acot⁡2B+cot⁡2Bcot⁡2C+cot⁡2Ccot⁡2A

Now,

A+B+C=0

⇒2A+2B+2C=0

⇒tan⁡2A+2B+2C=0

⇒tan⁡2A+tan⁡2B+tan⁡2C=tan⁡2Atan⁡2Btan⁡2C

⇒cot⁡2Acot⁡2B+cot⁡2Bcot⁡2C+cot⁡2Ccot⁡2A=1

⇒∑cot⁡B+C-Acot⁡C+A-B=1

questions.nameText: If A+B=π4 , then tan⁡A+1tan⁡B+1  is equal to

⇒tan⁡A+tan⁡B+tan⁡Atan⁡B=1

⇒1+tan⁡A1+tan⁡B=1+1=2

questions.name: Ifcos⁡x+cos⁡y+cos⁡α=0 andsin⁡x+sin⁡y+sin⁡α=0, then cot⁡x+y2 is equal to
questions.nameText: Ifcos⁡x+cos⁡y+cos⁡α=0 andsin⁡x+sin⁡y+sin⁡α=0,  then cot⁡x+y2 is equal to
questions.solution:
Given equations may be written as

cos⁡x+cos⁡y=-cos⁡α

andsin⁡x+sin⁡y=-sin⁡α

⇒2cos⁡x+y2cos⁡x-y2=-cos⁡α …(i())

and 2sin⁡x+y2cos⁡x-y2=-sin⁡α …(ii)

From Eqs.(i)and (ii),we get

2cos⁡x+y2cos⁡x-y22sin⁡x+y2cos⁡x-y2= cos⁡αsin⁡α

⇒cot⁡x+y2=cot⁡α

questions.nameText: In a ∆ABC, if a=8,b=10 and c=12, then C is equal to
questions.solution:
We have,

cos⁡C=a2+b2-c22ab=82+102-1222×8×10=18

And,

cos⁡A=b2+c2-a22bc=102+122-822×10×12=34

∴cos⁡2A=2cos2⁡A-1=2×916-1=18 =

Thus, we have

cos⁡2A=cos⁡C⇒2A=C

questions.nameText: If in a ∆ ABC, sides a,b,c are in A.P., then tan⁡A2tan⁡C2=

Now,

tan⁡A2tan⁡C2=(s-b)(s-c)s(s-a)×(s-a)(s-b)s(s-c)

⇒tan⁡A2tan⁡C2=s-bs=2s-2b2s=3b-2b3b=13

⇒cos2⁡x=cot2⁡z-1    ∵cos⁡y=tan⁡z ∴sec⁡y=cot⁡z

⇒1+cos2⁡x=tan2⁡x1-tan2⁡x∵cos⁡z=tan⁡x

questions.name: If θ lies in the first quadrant which of the following is not true
questions.nameText: If θ lies in the first quadrant which of the following is not true
questions.solution:
Consider the function fθ given by

fθ=θ2-sin⁡θ2 , where 0≤θ≤π2

We have,

f''θ=121-cos⁡θ2>0  ∵0≤θ≤π2

⇒fθ is increasing on 0, π/2

⇒fθ>f0 for 0≤θ≤π2

⇒θ2-sin⁡θ2>0 for 0≤θ≤π2

⇒θ2>sin⁡θ2 for 0≤θ≤π2

On the same lines it can be seen that all other conditions are true except condition given in option (b)

questions.nameText: In any ∆ ABC, if cot⁡A2,cot⁡B2,cot⁡C2  are in A.P., ,then a,b,c are in

questions.name: If xsin3⁡θ+ycos3⁡θ=sin⁡θcos⁡θ and xsin⁡θ=ycos⁡θ , then x2+y2 is
questions.nameText: If xsin3⁡θ+ycos3⁡θ=sin⁡θcos⁡θ  and xsin⁡θ=ycos⁡θ , then x2+y2  is

questions.name: If 32tan8⁡θ=2cos2⁡α-3cos⁡α and 3cos⁡2 θ=1, , then α=
questions.nameText: If 32tan8⁡θ=2cos2⁡α-3cos⁡α  and 3cos⁡2 θ=1, , then α=
questions.solution:
We have,

32tan8⁡θ=2cos2⁡α-3cos⁡α and cos⁡2 θ=13

Now,

cos⁡2 θ=13⇒1-tan2⁡θ1+tan2⁡θ=13⇒tan2⁡θ=12

∴32tan8⁡θ=2cos2⁡α-3cos⁡α

⇒32×116=2cos2⁡α-3cos⁡α

⇒2=2cos2⁡α-3cos⁡α

⇒2cos2⁡α-3cos⁡α-2=0

⇒2cos⁡α+1cos⁡α-2=0        ∵cos⁡α-2≠0

⇒2cos⁡α+1=0

⇒cos⁡α=-12⇒cos⁡α=cos⁡2 π3⇒α=2n π±2π3,n∈Z

questions.nameText: If in a triangle ABC,b+c=3a, then tan⁡B2tan⁡C2  is equal to

sin⁡A=1⇒sin⁡B=1, ,which is not possible

questions.name: If sin⁡2x,12 and cos⁡2x are in A..P., then the general values of x are given by
questions.nameText: If sin⁡2x,12  and cos⁡2x  are in A..P., then the general values of x are given by
questions.solution:
It is given that

questions.nameText: One-fourth of a herd of cows is in the forest. Twice the square root of the herd has gone to mountains and the remaining 15 are on the banks of a river. The total number of cows is:
questions.solution:
Let the number of cows = x

Then, according to the question, 2x+14x+15=x. .

or, 2x-34x+15=0

or, 8x-3x+60=0

or, 3x-8x-60=0

or, 3x2-18x+10x-60=0

or, 3xx-6+10x-6=0

or, x-63x+10=0

or, x=6 and x=-103

or, x=36 and x=1009

But, x=1009 is discarded [∵ No. of cows can’t be in fraction]

So, x=36

Therefore, the number of cows =x=36.

questions.nameText: Deepak said to Prakash, “That boy playing football is the younger of the two brothers of the daughter of my father’s wife.” How is the boy playing football related to Deepak?
questions.solution:
Father’s wife ⇒ Mother

Mother’s Daughter ⇒ Sister

Deepak’s sister’s younger brother ⇒ Deepak’s younger brother.

Therefore, the ‘boy’ is the brother of ‘Deepak’.

questions.name: If ''P $ Q'' means ''P is father of Q''; ''P # Q'' means ''P is mother of Q''; ''P * Q'' means ''P is sister of Q'', then how is D related to N in N # A $ B * D?
questions.nameText: If ''P $ Q'' means ''P is father of Q''; ''P # Q'' means ''P is mother of Q''; ''P * Q'' means ''P is sister of Q'', then how is D related to N in N # A $ B * D?
questions.solution:
N # A ⇒ N is mother of A.

A $ B ⇒ A is father of B.

B * D ⇒ B is sister of D.

So, D ⇒ son or daughter of A.

N ⇒ mother of A.

Therefore, D is the grandson or granddaughter of ''N'' i.e. Data is inadequate.

questions.nameText: Suppose that an equal number of persons are born on each day. What will be the percentage of persons whose birthday will fall on 29th February?
questions.solution:
29th February falls in a leap year.

A leap year falls once in four years.

A normal year has 365 days while a leap year has 366 days.

∴ Required percentage =14×365+1×100

=11461×100=0.068% %

questions.nameText: If logx⁡a-b-logx⁡a+b=logx⁡ba,  find a2b2+b2a2.
questions.solution:
logx⁡a-ba+b=logx⁡ba

⇒aa-b=b(a+b)

⇒a2-ab=ab+b2

⇒a2-b2=2ab

⇒a2-2ab-b2=0

⇒ab2-2ab-1=0

This is a quadratic in ab. The product of the roots is −1,

i.e. if α is a root, then -1α will also be root, i.e.,

if ab (or α ) is one root, then the other root is -baor-1α.

Therefore, ab2+ba2=α2+1α2

=α+-1α2+2=22+2

= 6 (as the sum of the roots is 2)

questions.name: How many integers, greater than 999 but not greater than 4000, can be formed with the digits 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4, if repetition of digits is allowed?
questions.nameText: How many integers, greater than 999 but not greater than 4000, can be formed with the digits 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4, if repetition of digits is allowed?
questions.solution:
The smallest number in the series is 1000, a 4-digit number.

The largest number in the series is 4000, the only 4-digit number to start with 4.

The left most digit (thousands place) of each of the 4 digit numbers other than 4000 can take one of the 3 values 1 or 2 or 3.

The next 3 digits (hundreds, tens and units place) can take any of the 5 values 0 or 1 or 2 or 3 or 4.

Hence, there are 3 ×5 ×5 ×5 or 375 numbers from 1000 to 3999.

Including 4000, there will be 376 such numbers.

questions.nameText:
Directions: Answer the questions based on the following information.

A string of three English letters is formed as per the following rules

(i) The first letter is any vowel.

(ii) The second letter is m, n or p.

(iii) If the second letter is m, then the third letter is any vowel which is different from the first letter.

(iv) If the second letter is n, then the third letter is e or u.

(v) If the second letter is p, then the third letter is the same as the first letter.

There are 12 towns grouped into four zones with three towns per zone. It is intended to connect the towns with telephone lines such that every two towns are connected with three direct lines if they belong to the same zone and with only one direct line otherwise. How many direct telephone lines are required?
questions.solution:
Thus every zone will have 3 + 3 + 3 = 9 lines internally for the three towns. So total = 36 lines for 4 zones (9 ×4 = 36).

Now suppose we talk of town A connecting to town of other zones. Then, it will have to connect to 9 towns.

So 9 lines. Same for the other two town in the same zones. So, there will be 27 lines. Similarly towns of zone 2 will connect two 6 other towns .... So 6 + 6 + 6 = 18 and finally 9 lines for zone 3.

Total lines will be 36 + 27 + 18 + 9 = 90.

x2+yxy=336,y2+xxy=112, then x+y is
questions.nameText:
If x and y are positive real numbers satisfying the system of equations

x2+yxy=336,y2+xxy=112, then x+y is
questions.solution:
We have,

x2=yxy=336

⇒xxx+yy=336

and y2+xxy=112

⇒yyy+xx=112

Dividing Eq. (i) by Eq. (ii), we get

xy=3 or x=9y

From Eq. (i), 81y2+y9y2=336

or 81y2+3y2=336

⇒y2=4,y=2

⇒x=18

∴x+y=18+2=20

questions.name: The average marks of boys in a class is 52 and that of girls is 42. The average marks of boys and girls combined is 50. The percentage of boys in the class is
questions.nameText: The average marks of boys in a class is 52 and that of girls is 42. The average marks of boys and girls combined is 50. The percentage of boys in the class is
questions.solution:
Given, combined average of class is 50. Let number of boys in class be x and number of girls in class be y.

By combined average formula,

50=52×x+42+yx+y

⇒50x+50y=52x+42y

⇒8y=2x

⇒xy=41

⇒xx+y=45

Hence, ratio of boys to total number of students is 45

and percentage =45×100=80%. .

questions.name: How many even integers between 4000 and 7000 have four different digits?
questions.nameText: How many even integers between 4000 and 7000 have four different digits?
questions.solution:
Between 4000 to 5000, choose unit digit in 4 ways (0, 2, 6, 8) = 4

Choose tenth place of remaining 8 numbers = 8 (because 2 even number out of 10 numbers are already taken)

Choose hundred place by remaining 7 numbers = 7 ways

Total number ways between 4000 to 5000 = 4 × 8 × 7 = 224

Similarly, for 5000 to 6000,

Unit digit is chosen in 5 ways

(0, 2, 6, 8, 4) = 5

Tenth digit is chosen in 8 ways = 8

Thousandth digit is chosen by remaining 7 numbers = 7 ways

Total number ways = 5 × 8 × 7 = 280

Similarly, for 6000 to 7000

Total number ways 4 × 8 × 7= 224

Hence, total number ways for 4000 to 7000

= 224 + 280 + 224 = 728
